intro: Hibiscus verdcourtii, commonly known as the Congo hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central and West Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters tall, characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically red or pink in color, with a prominent yellow center. Hibiscus verdcourtii thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the Malvaceae family.
